instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
This board works fine with 85w charger and charge fine  but when switch to 
45w charger show light on the charger  then  go off .
tried different 45 w but same result .
assuming there something wrong with PP3v42-g3h ?

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
Any chance the 85W charger is a fake?

Sounds like it has issues communicating with the charger. Does swapping I/O boards resolve the issue? I/O Cable looking ok as well?
Does the system still detect the charger or not? If it does detect the charger, does it charge the battery from it without the light working?

Just running through the basics before we're digging into circuits

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
We use only original apple charger 
replaced the I/o board flex cable too not charging with 45w no light on the charger and not charging the battery .
but charge with 85w and now tired 60w it is charging .
i found the R7121 missing , soldered new one but still same issue .
not sure if the u7100 is the issue .

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
Check all components around Q7010.
It happened for me with 00164 and found corrosion there...

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
Just to be sure, the 45W doesn't get detected by the system at all? Or does it simply just not charge with the 45W?

Voltage of PPDCIN_G3H with the 45W charger connected?

If its charging with 60W+ chargers I doubt U7100 itself is the culpit, I would suspect the SMC the most but even that woudn't explain why it does charge over 60W and 85W chargers. The only difference between those chargers is the voltage slightly...

Does the board look OK physically? Any history?

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
I just remembered.
In my case, R7012 found degraded to 10k, because of corrosion.
45W charger went to protection mode, no magsafe light at all...

It was charging and working good with 60W and 85W charger too.

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
2informaticos , you are right , the 45w charger goes to protection status and to use it again even with good working laptop 
I must unplug it from the outlet then plug again 
but I checked around Q7010 there no corrosion around 
and looks clean no burn or damaged chipset.
replaced the R7012 which gives 68k but still same result .:(:(

threads.title: Another 820-00165 charging with 85w only
threads.message:
Measure all the components in that area.
Get voltages with 60/85W charger connected, that can help.
